intro: Scrophularia herminii var. bourgaeana, commonly known as the Bourganeau scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in racemes. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive floral display.
